content: Waste4Change was first initiated based on a discussion between PT Greeneration Indonesia & Ecobali (PT Bumi Lestari Bali) in an effort to create a company whose mission is to reduce the number of waste that end up in landfills
Waste4Change is officially founded by Mohamad Bijaksana Junerosano under the name PT Wasteforchange Alam Indonesia
Waste4Change's very first Material Recovery Facility is constructed in Vida Bumipala, East Bekasi, Indonesia
Waste4Change cooperated with RDF technology provider to launch the Zero Waste to Landfill program
Waste4Change launched the Extended Producer Responsibility (EPR) program
Waste4Change co-organized the first Indonesia Circular Economy Forum (ICEF) in collaboration with Greeneration Foundation
Waste4Change launched its Send Your Waste (SYW) and Dropbox programs
Waste4Change was selected as 1 out of 8 chosen social entrepreneurs in the DBS-NUS Social Venture Challenge Asia 2018
Waste4Change officially acquired the Black Soldier Flies (BSF) breeding facility in Sidoarjo
Waste4Change was awarded as The Most Responsible Company by World's Most Valued Business (MVB) Indonesia
Waste4Change acquired investments from Agaeti Ventures and Partners to increase the waste-processing quality and quantity in the Material Recovery Facility
Waste4Change launched Recycle 4.0 program to establish collaboration with local recycling partners and waste banks throughout Indonesia for responsible waste management
Waste4Change received King Sejong & Jang Yeongsil Prize grant from KOICA for the development of waste management system based on a smart-city platform
Waste4Change officially acquired Sampah Muda, a waste management startup based ini Semarang
Waste4Change is selected as the winner out of 15 participants of Social Entrepreneur Bootcamp DBS Bank Indonesia

mission.title: Strategy
mission.message: Shifting the Waste Management Ecosystem towards a More Responsible, Collaborative, and Technology-based Waste Management System that Supports the Implementation of Circular Economy

vision.title: Vision
vision.message: To Become A Leader in Providing Ethical and Responsible Waste Management Solutions

items.title: Consult
items.description: Provide data-driven analysis and local expert insights to optimize waste management solutions

items.title: Campaign
items.description: Offer facilitation and education program across stakeholders to create ecosystem change towards Circular Economy

items.title: Collect
items.description: Provide segregated waste collection, segregated waste bin, as well as waste journey report

items.title: Create
items.description: Process the collected waste in a responsible way to become recycled material

items.title: Client
message: More than 50 Private Companies and Government Bodies
More than 2,0000 Houses for Residential Waste Pickup
More than 4,000 People Graduated from Responsible Waste Management Academy (AKABIS)

items.title: Facilities & Manpower
message: 2 Existing Material Recovery Facilities: Organic and Inorganic Waste Processing

items.title: Number of Waste Collected and Managed
message: A Total of 5,456 tons of Waste Collected and Managed
An Average of 10 Tons of Waste Processed Per Day

culture.subtitle: Here's A Glimpse of What Life at Waste4Change Looks Like

team.subtitle: Meet The People Who are Working Passionately to Solve Indonesia's Waste Problems
